16, 19, 13, 3, 28, 24, 17, 23, 13, 11, 16, 9, 30, 17, 13, 24.

I should double-check if maybe I'm misinterpreting the scores. Alternatively, perhaps the format is "Opponent score - Patriot score". So in Row 4, maybe it's Opponent 10, Patriots 3? 30, 28, 24, 24, 23, 19, 17, 17, 16, 16, 13, 13, 13, 11, 9, 3.

So the second-highest is 28. Therefore, the claim says the second most is 30, which would mean that they scored 30 twice or higher than that exists. But in our list, 30 is only once, and 28 comes next. So the second highest should be 28.
